snippet: The Major League Baseball Players Association said the league was in the process of interviewing players for its investigation into the Biogenesis clinic.
abstract: MLB players' union is cautioning against any prejudging of baseball's current doping inquiry in light of disclosure that Anthony Bosch, head of the now-shuttered Biogenesis clinic in South Florida, has agreed to cooperate with baseball's investigators; league's investigators have begun interviewing players connected to the clinic.

byline.original: By STEVE EDER and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: The Major League Baseball Players Association said the league was in the process of interviewing players for its investigation into the Biogenesis clinic.

headline.seo: Union Says M.L.B. Is Interviewing Players in Doping Inquiry
headline.main: Baseball Union Says Judgment Should Wait in Clinic Case
headline.print_headline: Union Cautions That Judgment Shouldn’t Precede Conclusion of Inquiry
